On Jan 7, 2007, at 10:00 PM, Mike Schinkel wrote:

> Roy T. Fielding wrote:
>> Canonical URLs means that new links are created to the
>> same URL asprevious links, which increases linked-to values,
>> which increases both the perceived node value of a hub and
>> the corresponding values of the nodes that link to that hub.
>
> What are the tangible places that where having a single canoncial URL
> provides benefits?
>
> -- Search engine ranking
> -- Router and Proxy caches
> -- Anywhere else?

Think differently:

The overall value of the graph of resources and links increases as  
hub value increases.
It is not a technical or application question but how useful the  
overall graph is.

Jan
